channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Page Builder: Pagelayer
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Page Builder: Pagelayer

item.title: CVE-2023-4687|2024-08-02T07:31:06.695Z -- unknown -- page%20builder%3A%20pagelayer
item.description: The Page Builder: Pagelayer WordPress plugin before 1.7.7 doesn't prevent unauthenticated attackers from updating a post's header or footer code on scheduled posts.

item.title: CVE-2023-5124|2024-08-02T07:44:53.790Z -- unknown -- page%20builder%3A%20pagelayer
item.description: The Page Builder: Pagelayer WordPress plugin before 1.8.0 doesn't prevent attackers with administrator privileges from inserting malicious JavaScript inside a post's header or footer code, even when unfiltered_html is disallowed, such as in multi-site WordPress configurations.

item.title: CVE-2023-5087|2024-08-02T07:44:53.919Z -- unknown -- page%20builder%3A%20pagelayer
item.description: The Page Builder: Pagelayer WordPress plugin before 1.7.8 doesn't prevent attackers with author privileges and higher from inserting malicious JavaScript inside a post's header or footer code.

item.title: CVE-2023-7115|2024-08-02T08:50:08.049Z -- unknown -- page%20builder%3A%20pagelayer
item.description: The Page Builder: Pagelayer WordPress plugin before 1.8.1 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2023-7115|2024-06-04T17:17:26.166Z -- unknown -- page%20builder%3A%20pagelayer
item.description: The Page Builder: Pagelayer WordPress plugin before 1.8.1 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)
